description2: Each entry in 'viewSetSelectorArray' gives:
the path of a view definition set (AMD) module file,
the name of a view def set (within that file),
optionally, a description of the case
the conditions (UseCases) under which this viewSet is to be used
Conditions will likely evolve over time.  For now we use:
app                     -- the name of the application we want to use (COMPARE, MERGE,...)
roles                   -- (can be ['*'] which is default for CSV) the roles applicable
preferredRole           -- preferred role for this use case. This will move the view set selector to the top of the list
minNumberOfObjects      -- Minimum Number of objects for comparison. DEFAULT is 2
maxNumberOfObjects      -- Minimum Number of objects for comparison. DEFAULT is 2. For no limit put -1
defaultPropertiesOnly   -- For default internal compare only. DO NOT USE. The view set is the default properties only comparison for unsupported types
typeInfoArray           -- array containing the type info for comparison {
type -- the type of object. DEFAULT is *
service -- the service of the object. DEFAULT is *
requiredInterfacesinterfaces -- array of required interfaces. DEFAULT null. When match considered only when all interfaces match input
optionalAllowedInterfaces -- DEFAULT * i.e. any interface is allowed. For specific ones allowed supply a list
*NOTES*
1. For matching a type to itself only one entry required in the typeInfoArray
2. For the same type and two different set of requiredInterfaces, or two different types separate entries required in the typeInfoArray
3. For no interfaces put empty arrays for both required and optional interfaces i.e. []
4. Interface matching only applicable for 3DSpace as of now
